author: Rick Spilman
content:
According to NOAA: A nautical chart represents hydrographic data, providing very detailed information on water depths, shoreline, tide predictions, obstructions to navigation such as rocks and shipwrecks, and navigational aids.

The term ‚Äúmap,‚Äù on the other hand, emphasizes landforms and encompasses various geographic and cartographic products. Some examples of maps might be road maps or atlases, or city plans. A map usually represents topographical information.

https://oceanservice.noaa.gov/facts/chart_map.html

author: Doug Bostrom
content:
